info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-hotspot-cfg
info.description:
Model for managing WiFi Alliance Hotspot 2.0 and 802.11u configuration
     Copyright (c) 2019-2020, 2022 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

**Configuration Module**
**Module:** `Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-hotspot-cfg`
**Paths:** 16

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-hotspot-cfg structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-wireless-hotspot-cfg.html)

get.description: Configuration for the WiFi Alliance Hotspot 2.0 (Passpoint) capabilities of the wireless controller, including configuration for 802.11u

put.description: Create or replace Configuration for the WiFi Alliance Hotspot 2.0 (Passpoint) capabilities of the wireless controller, including configuration for 802.11u

patch.description: Partially modify Configuration for the WiFi Alliance Hotspot 2.0 (Passpoint) capabilities of the wireless controller, including configuration for 802.11u

delete.description: Delete Configuration for the WiFi Alliance Hotspot 2.0 (Passpoint) capabilities of the wireless controller, including configuration for 802.11u

put.description: Create or replace Configuration of all the different ANQP Servers available on the wireless controller

delete.description: Delete Configuration of all the different ANQP Servers available on the wireless controller

internet-enabled.description: Indicates to 802.11u and Hotspot 2.0 wireless clients if they can get Internet access on this Hotspot 2.0 WLAN

anqp-domain-id-present.description: When this element is set, the domain ID from anqp-domain-id is advertised in the Hotspot 2.0 beacon and probe requests

load-measurement-duration.description: Duration over which the Downlink Load and Uplink Load have been measured

full-capacity-link.description: Set if WAN link is currently operating at its maximum capacity

is-beacon.description: Indicates whether this roaming entry is included in the WLAN beacon (Maximum 3)
